column1: Carbohydrates are chemical compounds that contain only oxygen
column2: hydrogen and carbon. They are made up of joined-up sugars. Sugars have the general formula Cm(H2O)n
column3: and are also known as saccharides.Certain carbohydrates are an important storage and transport form of energy in most organisms
column4: including plants and animals.Carbohydrates are the most common source of energy for the human body. Protein builds tissue and cells in the body. Carbohydrates are very good for energy
column6: if a person eats more than needed
column7: the extra is changed into fat.If necessary
column8: humans can live without eating carbohydrates because the human body can change proteins into carbohydrates. People of some cultures eat food with very little carbohydrates
column9: but they still remain healthy.Research in the United States and Canada have shown that people get about 40% to 60% of their energy from carbohydrates. However
column10: studies suggest that some people get at least 55% to 75% of energy from carbohydrates. It may depend on the amount of physical work done by people: the harder the work
